Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech, which is essential for a democratic society.
Censorship is more damaging than misinformation and disinformation.
There are conflicts of interest in institutions influenced by financial incentives from large companies, particularly pharmaceutical companies.
The bill could compromise professional ethics, especially in the medical field, by restricting honest communication with patients.
The bill represents government overreach and increases compliance costs for small businesses.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of Speech is a hallmark of a democratic society. Any curtailment of this freedom will inevitably lead to tyranny.
Censorship is far more damaging than misinformation and disinformation.
This is the domain of tyrants and the method all totalitarian governments work from. This is un-Australian.
It is against medical ethics to inject a medical product... without giving true informed consent.
I am confident the vast majority of Australians will agree with me, that 'Less government red tape' is what the Australian people want.
